ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Christian, you should try to look at your libraries and search for exact this symbol (_ZTVN7Cantera5PhaseE). Maybe the compiler generates a second

Hello Christian,

you should try to look at your libraries and search for e=
xact this symbol
(_ZTVN7Cantera5PhaseE). Maybe the compiler generates a sec=
ond underscore, so
you find "__ZTVN7Cantera5PhaseE". In g77 there is an opt=
ion
-fno-second-underscore, to prevent this. I also see that you are runnin=
g an
64-bit machine, this could also lead to an missing library. On my
linx=
-64bit-machnine your symbol exists in libcantera.a. I will check this
demo =
on my machine and see what I can do.

ulf

-----Urspr=FCngliche Nachricht--=
---
Von: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com] Im Auftra=
g von
christianbeck2000
Gesendet: Mittwoch, 19. Oktober 2005 10:34
An: cant=
era@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: [cantera] Advice on Cantera linking problem...=



Hello,

I am currently attempting to couple Cantera to a CFD solver. The=
refore 
I need to create a shared library. As a starting point I use the 
C=
antera F77 interface that comes with the current stable distribution. 
I am=
 working on a x86 Linux system with the g77 and g++ compilers. 
Unfortunate=
ly I ran into some linker problems, which seem to be 
Cantera related. 

Th=
e F77 interface and demo compile and run fine on my system (with the 
modif=
ications posted on this list). 

In the next step I included the content of=
 demo.f as a subroutine into 
a cant.F, which will be called by the CFD sol=
ver. My makefile then 
does the following:


/usr/bin/g77 -fpic -I/usr/loca=
l/share/3D/include -O3 -g -fno-second-
underscore -o linux-amd64//cant.o -c=
 cant.F /usr/bin/g++ -fpic
-I/usr/local/share/3D/include -O3 -Wall -I/home/=

itsnas/beck/cantera64/include -v -o linux-amd64//demo_ftnlib.o -c 
demo_ft=
nlib.c
/usr/bin/g77 -shared -L/home/itsnas/beck/SharedLibraries64/linux-amd=
64 
-luser -loneD -lzeroD -ltransport -lcantera -lrecipes -lcvode - lctlapa=
ck
-lctblas -lctmath -ltpx -lg2c -lconverters =96lctcxx -o ./
linux-amd64//=
libcant.so linux-amd64//cant.o linux-amd64//demo_ftnlib.o

The compiling an=
d linking process run through without an error 
message. If I call the shar=
ed library from the CFD code a problem 
occurs. 

/home/itsnas/beck/SharedL=
ibraries64/linux-amd64/libcant.so: undefined 
symbol: _ZNSt24__default_allo=
c_templateILb1ELi0EE12_S_free_listE

After some grepping I found this strin=
g in the standard c++ Library. 
Including -lstdc++ in the linker call solve=
s this problem.


Now a new problem occurs:

/home/itsnas/beck/SharedLibrar=
ies64/linux-amd64/libcant.so: undefined 
symbol: _ZTVN7Cantera5PhaseE

At t=
his I am out of ideas for solving the problem. If someone can come 
up with=
 advice I would be most grateful.

regards,
Christian Beck
